page.title: 05BELLINGHAM HOUSING.
page.content: Bellingham is the major place of activity in our block. In Bellingham there are three council estates, but only two are in our block, Westlands and Fairshaw Crescent,which is the older of the two.It was built in the early 1950s by a local firm. There are between fifty and sixty houses in Westlands making it the biggest estate in Bellingham.Once a tenant has lived on an estate for more than two years he is able to buy his house,but before he buys it ,no major alterations may be made.At regular intervals of two/three years the houses are painted and rewired. Outside the main town of Bellingham housing is on farms which are usually privately owned.
